formattedAddress: 60 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 60 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Lincoln Center-set conservatory for the performing arts, including theater, music, dance & writing.

originalText.text: Amazing experience. It is a beautiful place. You can enter into some areas or halls of the school with pictures of great artists and dancers. The area in front of it is amazing, with seats where you can admire the view, rest and have great time with your friends, as nice pictures. It is worth visiting it if you like dance and know a little about the school. It is well-know and many times appears in hollywood movies. It is New York so I think it is best to get there by metro (subway), if you are by car, you have to find a park-in-lot and pay for it. Well located too, close to many other touristics sites, stations and restaurants.

originalText.text: I thought about stopping in here to show off my mad skills but decided it would discourage the students from their potential. A quick photo from the outside would have to do for now since I’m exceptionally busy practicing 16 hours a day as a self taught professional.

originalText.text: Just left from visiting the campus! Ugh this is definitely my school and I hope I'm accepted! Can't wait! I'm taking a year off and going to enjoy New York but looking forward to next fall :)

originalText.text: I attended the Pre-College program at Juilliard way back in 1985. It was an emotional experience to bring my kids back to see and hear the sights and sounds of this iconic location. At present, I can barely recognize the place as much renovation is being done. Also, so beautiful at the time of my visit to see the music hall draped in the Ukrainian Flag! It brought me to tears - now being an aged man. I remember sitting next to Midori in one of the youth performances. My lessons with Eugene Becker and Mrs. Delay. Juilliard is a world renowned school of music. Back in my day, and being a person of color, it was somewhat bitter sweet. However, the school has worked endlessly to support and promote the arts to a diverse crowd. This truly shows as I now see so many young and talented children of color representing our famous institution. I never thought I would see this in my lifetime. I always knew such talent existed, but to see my own school recognize and promote is another story. Juilliard is an institution that you must visit at least once in your life. The talent held in this location is world class artists that do what I consider is "God's Work" - that is, the promotion of artistry of mankind.

originalText.text: I’m 13yo and my dream is to become a professional violinist, I hope that if I work hard enough to audition when the time comes that I can get in, I’m determined to get in and I hope I do no matter what I want to choose a profession that will make me happy in life.
